> 
> I guess they changed every mission?

Mike, the U-shaped pallets you made awhile ago are actually the SpaceLab pallets.

I have some (AckchyuallyIt'sAlot) of suggestions. 

> 
> ![sts052-80-030_lrg.jpg](http://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/Features/ShuttleRetrospective/images/sts052-80-030_lrg.jpg)
> 
> The sun-shielding clamshell satellite cradle (which I see has already begun development) in the rear, the MPESS carrier truss in the center would be great to mount EVA equipment and small parts on. On the right side of the payload bay is a Hitchhiker experiment module. Those'd be good for science generation, akin to (but much smaller than) a Science Jr.
> 
>

![9shWFYt.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/9shWFYt.jpg)![9NmZrvx.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/9NmZrvx.jpg)

I was meaning what goes on the pallets for the spacelab...

Daaaaamn, mike, that was fast! I was gonna edit my post to additionally suggest the ICC Lite, but you already made it an alternate texture of the MPESS. Awesome!

Could you put another ICC lite on the end of the first one, much in the same way you did with the SpaceLab pallets?

- - - Updated - - -

Here are some various payloads carried aboard the SpaceLab pallets.

> 
> ![10063925.jpg](http://www.zerognews.com/galleria/images/shuttle/sts-35/10063925.jpg)
> 
> ASTRO-1 telescope in the OPF.
> 
> ![astro2-on-orbit.jpg](http://archive.stsci.edu/hut/images/astro2-on-orbit.jpg)
> 
> The base the telescopes are mounted to is called the Instrument Pointing System.
> 
> 

> 
> ![sts66payloadbay.jpg](http://www.americaspace.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/sts66payloadbay.jpg)
> 
> 

> 
> ![sts59orbit.jpg](http://www.americaspace.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/sts59orbit.jpg)
> 
> SRL-1 in Endeavour's payload bay. The long object behind the MPESS is a ground mapping antenna.
> 
> ![KSC-99PP-0973.jpg](http://science.ksc.nasa.gov/shuttle/missions/sts-99/images/medium/KSC-99PP-0973.jpg)
> 
> SRTM being loaded into Endeavour's payload bay. The pallet is clearly visible.
> 
> ![KSC-00PP-0090.jpg](http://science.ksc.nasa.gov/shuttle/missions/sts-99/images/medium/KSC-00PP-0090.jpg)
> 
> There weren't any good on-orbit photos I could find, but this shows all of STS-99's payload (which was also the final mission to use SpaceLab parts other than carrying Canadarm2 and Dextre to ISS).
> 
> These would make cool ScanSat parts or something akin to that mod.
> 
>
